Module it.polimi.ingsw.psp58
Package it.polimi.ingsw.psp58.controller

Class TurnController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.psp58.event.core.EventSource
it.polimi.ingsw.psp58.controller.TurnController
All Implemented Interfaces:
ControllerListener, EventListener
public class TurnController
extends EventSource
implements ControllerListener
This class filters VirtualView events, it creates a turn(on model) for current player and manages it. It also handles all the information and TurnAction related to the turn, operating with all the references it has on the model.

    private void invokeBuild​(Player player, Worker worker, BlockTypeEnum block, int x, int y)
    Checks if the player can actually build and if he can calls the performBuild method, otherwise sends an CV_GameErrorGameEvent

    checks if both movement and build are unavailable for chosen worker

    Removes the player from the turnSequence, decrements the numberOfPlayers, removes his worker from the island, sends a CV_GameOverEvent to the loser.

    • setUpAvailableMovements

      private void setUpAvailableMovements​(BehaviourManager behaviour, java.util.List<int[]> availableMovementsA, java.util.List<int[]> availableMovementsB)
      Adds all the available destination for both the worker A and the worker B
      Parameters:
      behaviour - the BehaviourManager of the player that has to make the move
      availableMovementsA - all the possible destination for the worker A
      availableMovementsB - all the possible destination for the worker B

    • setUpAvailableBuild

      private void setUpAvailableBuild​(java.util.List<int[]> availableBuildA, java.util.List<int[]> availableBuildB)
      Adds all the available cell in which the player can build with both the worker A and the worker B
      Parameters:
      availableBuildA - all the possible destination for the build of the worker A
      availableBuildB - all the possible destination for the build of the worker B

    • checkLose

      private boolean checkLose​(java.util.List<TurnAction> availableActions, java.lang.String player)
      Checks, during the calculation of the possible action of the turn, if the player has no possible action and so he has to lose
      Parameters:
      availableActions - the list of the possible TurnAction of the player
      player - the name of the player
      Returns:
      true if he lost, false otherwise

    • canMove

      private boolean canMove​(java.lang.String actingPlayer)
      Checks if MOVE is a possible action for the phase of the turn for the actingPlayer
      Parameters:
      actingPlayer - the name of the player that has to make an action
      Returns:
      true if MOVE is a possible action, false otherwise

    • canBuild

      private boolean canBuild​(java.lang.String actingPlayer)
      Checks if BUILD is a possible action for the phase of the turn for the actingPlayer
      Parameters:
      actingPlayer - the name of the player that has to make an action
      Returns:
      true if BUILD is a possible action, false otherwise

    • canPassTurn

      private boolean canPassTurn()
      Checks if PASS is a possible action for the phase of the turn for the actingPlayer
      Returns:
      true if PASS is a possible action, false otherwise

    • sendCommandExecuted

      private void sendCommandExecuted​(java.lang.String actingPlayer)
      Sends to the actingPlayer a CV_CommandExecutedGameEvent event to let the client know that the command has been executed correctly
      Parameters:
      actingPlayer - the recipient for the event

    • sendCommandRequest

      private void sendCommandRequest​(java.lang.String actingPlayer)
      Sends a CV_CommandRequestEvent to the actingPlayer containing all the possible TurnAction, movements and build that he can perform. If there aren't it calls the lose method because the actingPlayer has to lose the game
      Parameters:
      actingPlayer - the name of the player that has to perform an action

    • nextTurn

      private void nextTurn()
      Method called when a player perform a pass action and create a new Turn instance for the next player in the turnSequence. Then notify the actingPlayer calling the sendCommandRequest method.

    • win

      private void win​(Player winner)
      Sends the CV_GameOverEvent and then a CV_NewGameRequestEvent to all the players
      Parameters:
      winner - the name of the player that has won

    • lose

      private void lose​(java.lang.String player)
      Removes the player from the turnSequence, decrements the numberOfPlayers, removes his worker from the island, sends a CV_GameOverEvent to the loser. If is a two player match let the other player win, if is a three player one the losing player becomes a spectator.
      Parameters:
      player - the name of the player that lost the game

    • removePlayerFromGame

      private void removePlayerFromGame​(java.lang.String usernameToRemove)
      Removes a Player from the turnSequence remaking a new one if there are others players in the game
      Parameters:
      usernameToRemove - the name of the player to remove

    • sendIslandUpdate

      private void sendIslandUpdate()
      Sends a CV_IslandUpdateEvent with updated island, after an action has been performed, to all the players

    • invokeNextTurn

      private void invokeNextTurn​(Player player)
      invoked by the virtual view when a next turn event is called
      Parameters:
      player - player that is requiring the next turn

    • checkIsHisTurn

      private boolean checkIsHisTurn​(Player player)
      Checks if is the turn of the player
      Parameters:
      player - the player on which the method check if is his turn
      Returns:
      true if is the turn of the player, false otherwise

    • checkIsUsingTheSameWorker

      private boolean checkIsUsingTheSameWorker​(Worker worker)
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker to check if is the same of the one used before, if the player has already made a move
      Returns:
      true if the worker passed as argument is the worker used in the prior moves, false if is different or if it is the first move of the turn

    • performMove

      private void performMove​(Player player, Worker worker, int x, int y) throws InvalidMovementException, WinningException
      Performs the actual move. sends a CV_CommandExecutedGameEvent and the next CV_CommandRequestEvent calling the sendCommandRequest method
      Parameters:
      player - the player that makes the move
      worker - the worker he his using to make this move
      x - the x position where the player wants to move
      y - the y position where the player wants to move
      Throws:
      InvalidMovementException - if the player can't perform that move
      WinningException - if the player has won

    • invokeMovement

      private void invokeMovement​(Player player, Worker worker, int x, int y)
      Checks if the player can actually move and if he calls the performMove method, otherwise sends an CV_GameErrorGameEvent
      Parameters:
      player - the player that makes the move
      worker - the worker he his using to make this move
      x - the x position where the player wants to move
      y - the y position where the player wants to move

    • performBuild

      private void performBuild​(Player player, Worker worker, BlockTypeEnum block, int x, int y)
      Performs the actual build
      Parameters:
      player - the player that makes the build
      worker - the worker he his using to make this build
      block - the blockTypeEnum that the player wants to build
      x - the x position where the player wants to build
      y - the y position where the player wants to build

    • invokeBuild

      private void invokeBuild​(Player player, Worker worker, BlockTypeEnum block, int x, int y)
      Checks if the player can actually build and if he can calls the performBuild method, otherwise sends an CV_GameErrorGameEvent
      Parameters:
      player - the player that makes the build
      worker - the worker he his using to make this build
      block - the blockTypeEnum that the player wants to build
      x - the x position where the player wants to build
      y - the y position where the player wants to build

    • isCompletelyLocked

      private boolean isCompletelyLocked​(Worker.IDs workerChosen)
      checks if both movement and build are unavailable for chosen worker
      Parameters:
      workerChosen - the worker you started the turn with
      Returns:
      true if your choosen worker can't completely move or build

    • checkBuildCorrectness

      private void checkBuildCorrectness​(VC_PlayerCommandGameEvent event)
      Checks the block to build and calls the invokeBuild if it is possible, sends error messages otherwise
      Parameters:
      event - the VC_PlayerCommandGameEvent just arrived from the acting player of the turn

    • handleEvent

      public void handleEvent​(VC_PlayerCommandGameEvent event)
      Parses the VC_PlayerCommandGameEvent just received by the client, checks his correctness and eventually performs the action. Sends error messages otherwise.
      Specified by:
      handleEvent in interface ControllerListener
      Parameters:
      event - the event containing the command to compute

    • isCommandEventValid

      private boolean isCommandEventValid​(VC_PlayerCommandGameEvent commandEvent)
      Checks if the VC_PlayerCommandGameEvent received by the client is a correct and complete one
      Parameters:
      commandEvent - the VC_PlayerCommandGameEvent that has just received by the client
      Returns:
      true if the command is correct and complete, false otherwise
